title: Navigating across the Intelligence Center
description: You can navigate across the Intelligence Center by using the vertical menu on the left of the page. Clicking on any of the sections with the mouse pointer will take you into the relevant section.

title: Raising an Analyst query - Ask an Analyst
description: To raise an analyst query, you can click on the "Ask an Analyst" button (in green color) on the top-right corner of your page. The Ask an Analyst button is present across all sections. Upon clicking, you will be prompted to enter your query in a box. Once completed, your request will be shared with the designated team, which will begin work on your request.

title: Setting up Alerts
description: To set an alert, please click on the bell icon on the top-right corner of your page (the bell icon is placed to the left of the "Ask an Analyst" button). An alert notification box will then pop up on your screen. You can select the frequency as Daily, Weekly, or Fortnightly by clicking on the radio buttons. Scrolling down further allows you to set up alerts based on the different sections of the Intelligence Center. To set up alerts for all Product Trends, you can click on the "blue" button so that it turns to the "On" position. In addition, you can also set up alerts for specific keywords within each section. For this, click on the "+" button next to the section to open up a keyword box. Type in the desired keyword, and click on "Add keyword." Once done with the setup process, you may close the alert box by clicking on the "X" button on the top-right corner.

title: Searching for content
description: A universal search can be performed from any section in the Intelligence Center. The search box is at the top of each page. You will be able to search for content by entering free text (keywords) in the “Search” box. Once you hit “Enter” on your keyboard, an Advanced Search box will appear with all the matches to your search term displayed by each of the Intelligence Center’s sections: Home, Trends, New Product Tracker, Industry News, and FAQs. The default time period is the most current 6 months but you can modify that in the “From Date” and “To Date” fields. You can also add additional search conditions by opening the box labeled “Add Search Conditions” as well as selecting specific sections of the Intelligence Center in which to search.

title: Navigating back to the Home page
description: Click on the Kline logo on the top left corner of the Intelligence Center to navigate back to the Home page. This function will work on any section of the Intelligence Center

title: Access Kline's Salon Hair Care Database
description: To access Kline's Salon Hair Care databases, you can navigate to the Market Analyzer section and click on the database icon "Access Kline Databases and Analysis." Clicking on the icon will open the Salon Hair Care database on a new tab of your browser.

title: Accessing Kline's blogs and social media pages
description: The top left corner of each section of the Intelligence Center houses dedicated links to Kline's Pro Hair care blogs and social media pages.

title: Brands
description: A vast majority of brands covered throughout various sections of this Intelligence Center are the ones that are considered professional by Kline – they have a meaningful presence in salons and professional heritage. Some brands analyzed here also cover selected non-professional brands whose positioning and/or channel presence are directly competitive with professional heritage brands.

title: Category, Form and Function
description:
category Category Definition Segment Sub-Segment Definition
Conditioners Hair conditioner is a hair care product used to improve the feel, appearance and manageability of hair. Its main purpose is to reduce friction between strands of hair to allow easier brushing o r combing, which might otherwise cause damage. Various other benefits include hair repair, strengthening, or a reduction in split-ends.Conditioners are usually used after the hair has been washed with shampoo. Products impart singular or multiple benefits such as body, shine, softness, sealing the cuticle, and enhanced manageability.Conditioners are available in a wide range of forms including viscous liquids, gels and creams as well as thinner lotions and sprays. Form Cleansing Products that are intended for occasional use in place of a shampoo.(No-Shampoo method). They cleanse, balance, and refresh hair without stripping or depleting its natural oils.
Daily Rinse Daily rinse conditioners are typically available in lotion or cream form. They are applied to wet, freshly washed hair and rinsed out after a minute or two.
Function Anti-aging Products that refer to anti-aging or restoring youthfulness.
Clarifying Product used to remove buildup of other products.
Color Care These are color-enhancing or color-refreshing products. This also includes color depositing products.
Curl Care Products specifically formulated to enhance curly hair.
General/Multipurpose This is a single product that does not have a primary benefit but provides multiple benefits such as shine, moisturizing, volume, and repair/condition.
Moisturizing Products designed for dry hair to add moisture back in.
Repair/Condition This classification includes products that correct damage including split ends. Strengthening products that help reduce damage as well as those that help in bond realignment to prevent damage to the hair during color services are included.
Scalp Care Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp; leave hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Shine Products that add gloss or shine.
Smoothing/Frizz Control Products intended for dry, frizzy and unmanageable hair making it soft and smooth.
Thermal Care Products to protect hair from damage that can be caused by heat styling tools.
Thinning Hair Products formulated to fight hair loss.
UV/ Sun Protection Products that provide ultraviolet (UV) protection against the sun, preservation against hair color fading, and protection against environmental stresses.
Volumizing Products designed to lift the hair away from the scalp to create the illusion of fullness. A volumizing product focuses on the hair shaft to give volume throughout, using polymers to coat each fiber and add subtle stiffness.
Hair Styling Products and Sprays Products in this category are applied to the hair when wet, towel-dried, or completely dry and used for setting, sculpting, styling, and blow-dry styling of hair and for holding hair in place. Form Aerosol Aerosol products employ a dispensing system which creates a mist of liquid particles. They are usually applied to dry hair and function as finishing/styling products.
Cream Products that are a soft and light substance and that don't feel greasy or stiff when applied to hair.
Gel Gels are jelly-like products with varying viscosities that are used to style and manage hair; spray gels are gels in liquefied form that are pump-sprayed on to hair.
Glaze/Lotion Glazes/lotions consist of water or water-alcohol combinations that are fixatives poured onto the palm and applied with the fingers, brushes, combs, or other implements for styling.
Mousse Mousses are a highly liquefied formula that provide a foam when dispensed through an activator or aerator, or that may emerge as a gel and change to foam.
Non Aerosol Products that are similar to a spray but will be in a pump driven, spritz-type bottle. They can be applied to wet or dry hair and function as finishing, styling, or sculpting products.
Pomade/Paste Pomade and pastes are a greasy, waxy, or a water-based substance that is used to style hair. They give hair a shiny, slick appearance, and do not dry it out.
Powder Powders contain rough particles like silica silylate or rice powder to create matte texture by increasing friction between hair strands.
Function Curl Care Products specifically formulated to enhance curly hair.
General/Multipurpose This is a single product that does not have a primary benefit but provides multiple benefits such as shine, moisturizing, volume, and repair/condition.
Finishing Product to hold the style in place—the final step. Applied after desired look is achieved to hold in place. Usually (always?) a spray.
Shine Products that are applied wet or dry to provide shine.
Smoothing/Frizz Control Products that de-frizz the hair by coating it with silicones or oils to give it a smooth, healthy appearance.
Texturizing Creams, liquids, or gels that give slight texture, volume, and hold to the hair but are mainly used for creating a style. Used to ‘play’ with hair. To mold it into a certain look. Usually NOT a spray.
Thermal Care Products formulated for use with heated styling tools
Volumizing Products designed to specifically add volume or thickness to hair. They are often applied to roots to encourage hair shaft to expand and increase thickness and diameter of hair.
Shampoos Shampoos are hair and scalp cleansing products designed to remove dirt, oils, and buildup caused by other hair care products such as sprays and styling products. Some shampoos also improve manageability, styling, and the condition of hair. Form Dry Product that will stay dry and is not used with water.
Daily Rinse All other shampoo products.
Function Anti-aging Products that refer to anti-aging or restoring youthfulness.
Clarifying Products to clarify and work to remove copper, iron, hard water minerals and styling product build-up on all hair types.
Color Care These are color-enhancing or color-refreshing products. This also includes color depositing products.
Curl Care Products specifically formulated to enhance curly hair.
General/Multipurpose Shampoos that provides basic cleansing. They are formulated for all types of hair.
Moisturizing Products designed for dry hair to add moisture back in.
Repair/Condition Split Ends, Correct Damage, Strengthening- products that help reduce damage while simultaneously moisturizing would be classified as repair/condition
Scalp Care Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp which leaves hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Shine Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp which leaves hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Smoothing/Frizz Control Products intended for dry, frizzy and unmanageable hair making it soft and smooth.
Thermal Care Products to protect hair from damage that can be caused by heat styling tools.
Thinning Hair Products formulated to fight hair loss.
UV/ Sun Protection Products that provide ultraviolet (UV) protection against the sun, preservation against hair color fading, and protection against environmental stresses.
Volumizing Products designed to lift the hair away from the scalp to create the illusion of fullness. A volumizing product focuses on the hair shaft to give volume throughout, using polymers to coat each fiber and add subtle stiffness.
Treatments Products that provide deep treatment through application and are left on the hair longer than daily rinse conditioners. Hair treatments generally work in one of two ways: either they coat the hair to strengthen and protect the hair cuticles, or they penetrate the cuticle to provide nourishment and hydration. Form Detangler Product applied and left in the hair (typically when wet) to smooth the hair to allow for combing through tangles. Typically in non-aerosol spray format.
Dry Conditioner Product applied and left in the hair (typically when dry) to make hair shinier, smoother, and/or softer. Stays dry and not used with water or rinsed out. Usually in aerosol spray format.
Leave-in, Other Treatment that has conditioning properties but does not fall into one of the other segments. Includes leave-in treatments, tonics, and sprays that are not oils or specified as detanglers.
Oil Product that provides nourishing/conditioning to the health of the hair by sinking into and remaining in the strands. Not rinsed out.
Rinse-Out Treatment Product that is intended for deeper conditioning of hair and left on longer than a daily rinse conditioner before being rinsed out. Includes all masques and rinse-out serums.
Function Anti-aging Products that refer to anti-aging or restoring youthfulness.
Clarifying Product used to remove buildup of other products.
Color Care These are color-enhancing or color-refreshing products. This also includes color depositing products.
Curl Care Products specifically formulated to enhance curly hair.
General/Multipurpose This is a single product that does not have a primary benefit but provides multiple benefits such as shine, moisturizing, volume, and repair/condition.
Moisturizing Products designed for dry hair to add moisture back in.
Repair/Condition This classification includes products that correct damage including split ends. Strengthening- products that help reduce damage while simultaneously moisturizing would be classified as repair/condition. Products which help in bond realignment to prevent damage to the hair during color services are also included here.
Scalp Care Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp which leaves hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Shine Products that add gloss or shine.
Smoothing/Frizz Control Products intended for dry, frizzy and unmanageable hair making it soft and smooth.
Thermal Care Products to protect hair from damage that can be caused by heat styling tools.
Thinning Hair Products formulated to fight hair loss.
UV/ Sun Protection Products that provide ultraviolet (UV) protection against the sun, preservation against hair color fading, and protection against environmental stresses.
Volumizing Products designed to lift the hair away from the scalp to create the illusion of fullness. A volumizing product focuses on the hair shaft to give volume throughout, using polymers to coat each fiber and add subtle stiffness.
Kits/Promotions Items that are multi-packs or special sizes of a brand are to be put into this category. Related terms include: Kit, System, Set (i.e. Gift, Travel), Bonus, Duo, Trio, BOGO (Buy One, Get One), GWP (Gift with Purchase), PWP (Purchase with Purchase). Form Not Specified Since Kit/Promotions combine forms; a single form cannot be identified.
Function Anti-aging Products that refer to Anti-Aging or restoring youthfulness.
Clarifying Products to clarify and work to remove copper, iron, hard water minerals and styling product build-up on all hair types.
Color Care These are color-enhancing or color-refreshing products. This also includes color depositing products.
Curl Care Products specifically formulated to enhance curly hair.
General/Multipurpose Shampoos that provides basic cleansing. They are formulated for all types of hair.
Moisturizing Products designed for dry hair to add moisture back in.
Repair/Condition Split Ends, Correct Damage, Strengthening- products that help reduce damage while simultaneously moisturizing would be classified as repair/condition
Scalp Care Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp which leaves hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Shine Products formulated for itchy and dry scalp.They are designed to fight dandruff and dryness of scalp which leaves hair healthy, smooth and sleek.
Smoothing/Frizz Control Products intended for dry, frizzy and unmanageable hair making it soft and smooth.
Thermal Care Products to protect hair from damage that can be caused by heat styling tools.
Thinning Hair Products formulated to fight hair loss.
UV/ Sun Protection Products that provide ultraviolet (UV) protection against the sun, preservation against hair color fading, and protection against environmental stresses.
Volumizing Products designed to lift the hair away from the scalp to create the illusion of fullness. A volumizing product focuses on the hair shaft to give volume throughout, using polymers to coat each fiber and add subtle stiffness.
Hair Coloring Products Hair coloring products are designed to change the level and tone of natural or colored hair by varying the degrees of intensity and permanence; they also include developers.
• They are classified as permanent, semi- or demi-permanent, or temporary (including color rinses and refreshers). They also include developers, although temporaries usually do not require a developer.
• Bleaches and highlighting products that give lift and sometimes add tonality from ash to neutral to warm are also included, along with developers that are needed to perform these services.		 Form Permanent products : −        Permanent products provide long-term coloring lasting six to eight weeks until new hair grows out.
−        They work by causing an oxidation reaction between the coloring/dye component and the developer/peroxide (also referred to as the base product) to penetrate the cuticle and deposit hair coloring, sometimes down to the cortex of the hair shaft, to change the pigment.
−        The existing pigment is lifted, and the desired coloring is deposited; this process provides up to 100% gray coverage.
−        Permanent hair coloring products include high-lift blond shades that are sometimes used to highlight or blond hair.
Semi-permanent products: −        Hair dye only deposits color onto the hair – it does not penetrate the hair. It usually lasts for four to six weeks.
−        Demi-permanent hair coloring is longer-lasting semi-permanent coloring that utilizes lower volumes of developers (usually around 10%). Some demi-permanent hair colorings last for longer than six weeks. 
-  Semi-permanent hair coloring usually does not give 100% gray coverage.
Demi-permanent products: −        Demi-permanent hair coloring lasts longer than semi-permanent (approximately 2–3 months), and it utilizes some volumes of developers (usually around 10%).
−        These products can provide gray hair coverage, as demi-permanent hair dye penetrates the hair shafts slightly.
  Toners: −        They are hair coloring solutions that alter the tonality of the hair without major changes in the level (lightness or darkness) of hair.
−        Toners are used regularly with permanent hair color solutions to warm up color slightly, so that hair appears more natural rather than dyed all in one color.
−        The product is usually applied to pre-lightened hair, and the desired coloring is obtained by toning the hair to the required tonality.
Lighteners (Bleaches):   They provide maximum lightening by lifting the pigment in the hair shaft.
−        Developers that are non-generic but are dedicated to certain brands or lines of hair coloring are included in this section under their own brands or brands they are used in conjunction with.
- Bleaches are now available in newer and gentler formulations in both cream and powder formats.
−        Powder lighteners are used for making hair blond or blonder, frosting, tipping, highlighting, duo-lighting, and “balayage” or streaking—all techniques for contrasting pigment levels of hair. These can be used in conjunction with a toner to add warmth and depth to bleached hair.
Temporary/Rinse products: These are light, deposit-only formulations that usually wash out with shampooing because they merely coat the hair shaft with dye.
They generally use different dyes than those used in permanent and semi-permanent coloring. Some temporaries are leave-in sprays, gels, or liquids.
Function Black  
Blonde  
Brights  
Brunette  
Not Specified  
Red  
  Silver  
Hair Texturizing Hair straightening and perming products are designed to give curl and/or body to hair by breaking down and/or reconfiguring the cystine bonds of the hair to reshape it.

• Hair is wrapped or wound around rods or rollers of various diameters to give the desired curl formation. A wave solution is then applied, followed by a neutralizer, which normalizes the pH of the hair and sets the curl formation to the desired curl pattern.
• Hair perming products are usually acid, alkaline, or exothermic.
• Perms are being increasingly referred to as texturizers.
• All Japanese, Brazilian, and Bio-Ionic thermal straightening systems are now included. 		Form Not Specified  
Function Perms  
Relaxers  
Straighteners

header: About Professional Hair Care Intelligence Center
title: Methodology
description:
Professional Hair Care Intelligence Center Brochure

Social Sentiment Analysis - Methodology

The methodology can be explained over two steps: The first talks about the natural language processing (NLP) algorithms used by the program to automatically determine sentiment scores for social media posts/mentions. The second part explains how Kline configures the program to be able to assign sentiment scores to newly launched products. Social media platforms that are monitored include Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Reddit. 


  1. Sentiment analysis  

Each mention/social media post has a sentiment associated with it, which can be positive, negative, or neutral. The sentiment is assigned automatically based on models that are pre-trained on billions of words to have a deep general knowledge of over 100 languages before being applied to sentiment analysis, offering a more sophisticated understanding of the context, slang, and dialects. 

The tool has the ability to detect sentiment indicated by: 

  • Words (including misspellings), phrases, and sentence structure 

  • Emojis, emoticons, and multi-word hashtags 

  • Negation, punctuation, and much more 

 

  1. Configuring for newly launched products  

Each time a new product is launched, the platform needs to be configured so that it can start continuous/ongoing sentiment and mention tracking of the new product. Configuration involves the team at Kline creating and defining a rule (query) that gathers relevant mentions for the launched product. These mentions then form the basis for sentiment analysis. Below is a detailed explanation of how this is done. 

Creating rules: A rule or query is a combination of keywords, used by the algorithm to capture social media mentions/posts to perform sentiment analysis. The keywords within a rule are a combination of the brand name and the SKU name for a new product launch. For instance, Briogeo launched Don’t Despair, Repair. The corresponding rule to be written to capture mentions and sentiment data for this launch would be “Briogeo” AND "Don't Despair, Repair". The “AND” operator used in this rule will search for only those social media posts that contain the brand and product SKU names. 

Tweaking rules to ensure accurate mentions are captured: After a rule is created, a sample of mentions/posts is created and examined to ensure that each one is relevant. Any non-relevant mention (appearing in the sample) will require a further tweaking of the rule to ensure that such a mention is not captured going forward.
